fields.name: Subtitle
fields.value: Plans-at-a-Glance

fields.name: Company Name
fields.value: MetLife

fields.name: Simple Plan Name
fields.value: SIMPLE ADVANTAGESM PLAN

fields.name: Custom Plan Name
fields.value: CUSTOM ADVANTAGESM PLAN

fields.name: Simple Plan Type
fields.value: Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available - see below)

fields.name: Custom Plan Type
fields.value: Custom plan options (see column) - Monthly Reimbursement variants

fields.name: Issue Ages (Simple)
fields.value: 18 - 61 (premiums banded 18 - 30)

fields.name: Issue Ages (Custom)
fields.value: 18 - 84 (premiums banded 18 - 30)

fields.name: TBA Note
fields.value: *$1MM not available with Cash Benefit Rider

fields.name: Optional Riders Heading
fields.value: OPTIONAL RIDERS AVAILABLE WITH BOTH SIMPLE ADVANTAGE AND CUSTOM ADVANTAGE

fields.name: Shared Care Rider
fields.value: Insured and spouse/partner** can access benefits under each other's policy once the TBA under their own policy is exhausted. When insured dies, remaining TBA under his/her policy is transferred to the spouse's/partner's policy at no extra cost. Rider available at any time, subject to underwriting; Both spouse/partners must have identical policies.

fields.name: Nonforfeiture Rider
fields.value: Provides some benefits if policy lapses for nonpayment of premiums or if cancelled by insured. Rider must be in effect for 3 years and be in effect when the policy ends. Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA. Available at initial application only.

fields.name: Cash Benefit Rider
fields.value: Full MBA paid as cash payment (regardless of actual charges incurred) instead of reimbursement for covered services. Available at initial application only; $1MM TBA not available. Benefits paid over annual IRC limit may be taxable.

fields.name: Guaranteed Purchase Option (GPO) Heading
fields.value: GUARANTEED PURCHASE OPTION (GPO) (INCLUDED WITH SIMPLE ADVANTAGE ONLY)

fields.name: GPO Summary
fields.value: Insured able to purchase additional coverage every 3 years, up to age 65, with no additional underwriting; premium for increase in coverage is at attained age rates. Lifetime maximum increase available is 2x initial TBA and 2x initial MBA. Minimum of 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time GPO is exercised. Increases will not occur if insured is eligible for benefits. If insured rejects two increase offers in a row rider will end.

fields.name: Benefit Increase Options Heading
fields.value: BENEFIT INCREASE OPTIONS (AVAILABLE WITH CUSTOM ADVANTAGE ONLY)

fields.name: Future Purchase Option (FPO) Summary
fields.value: Increases the MBA and remaining portion of the TBA automatically by 5% of the MBA/remaining TBA in effect at the end of the previous policy year. Increases occur unless insured rejects, in writing, prior to the Policy Anniversary of the year in which the increase is to take effect. Corresponding increase in premium for increase in coverage at attained age rates. If insured rejects two times in a row, insured will no longer receive automatic increases; may request to have offers reinstated with no additional underwriting. Rider available at any time, subject to underwriting.

fields.name: Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Riders
fields.value: Increases the MBA and remaining portion of the TBA in effect at the end of the previous policy year, either 3% or 5%, with no corresponding increase in premium. Coverage increases continue while insured is eligible for benefits. Rider available at any time, with additional underwriting. 3% Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Rider and 5% Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Rider.

rows.value: Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available - see below)

fields.name: document_title
fields.value: Policy Features and Benefits May Vary By State

fields.name: main_header
fields.value: FEATURES & BENEFITS AVAILABLE WITH BOTH SIMPLE ADVANTAGETM AND CUSTOM ADVANTAGETM

fields.name: distribution_note
fields.value: FOR PRODUCER OR BROKER/DEALER USE ONLY. NOT FOR PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION.

fields.name: company_name
fields.value: Metropolitan Life Insurance Company

fields.name: company_address
fields.value: New York, NY 10166

fields.name: legal_blurb
fields.value: Not FDIC - Insured - Not Insured by Any Federal Government Agency - Not Issued, Guaranteed or Underwritten by Bank or FDIC - Not a Condition to the Provision or Term of Any Banking Service or Activity - Policy is an Obligation of the Issuing Insurance Company

tables.caption: Features & Benefits (both Simple Advantage and Custom Advantage)

rows.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Home care services including Nursing Care, Therapy services, Care Advisory Services, Homemaker Services; Services by Home Care Aide, Social Worker or Independent Caregiver; Hospice Care; Adult Day Care
Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Assisted Living Facility, Nursing Home, Hospice Facility
100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative

A MetLife Care Coordinator may authorize benefits for OLTC services not specifically defined as covered services under the policy, as long as the service meets needs of the insured and is cost-effective.
Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred to reserve insured's bed in a facility for any reason
If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate

Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA limits and doubling for International Benefit after 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider added, International Benefit modified; pays benefits outside US at 100% of MBA; EP will be 100 Calendar Days

Limited coverage if policy ends due to non-payment; provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: total amount of premium paid or 1x MBA; total benefits paid will not exceed the TBA in effect immediately prior to nonforfeiture date
1 visit per lifetime; EP does not need to be satisfied; If Care Management organization is selected by MetLife – no cost; if selected by insured – reimbursed up to $275 per lifetime
Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits
Coordination of Benefits (COB) and non-duplication of coverage with MetLife LTCI coverage and Medicare; non-duplication not applicable with Cash Benefit Rider
Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT); 10 Year Premium Payment Rider available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO; May impact tax deductibility
MetLife Care Coordinators available to answer questions about LTC coverage, services and discounts; insured can call for advice about caring for a loved one who needs LTC services
30% Spousal, 15% Marital, 15% Residential, 10% Preferred Health (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84), 5% or 10% Multi-Life Discount for approved cases
Preferred (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84), Standard & Substandard (Always quote Standard!)
Premium based on age 30 days prior to application date (underwriting requirements based on age at date of signed application)
With Premium (Conditional Receipt may apply): Date all underwriting requirements are met; Without Premium: 28 days following underwriting approval date
Insured has 30 days to review policy and if desired, return it for a full refund
Policy Delivery Receipt (PDR) must be signed within 30 days of Policy Approval Date

pageClassifications.label: other
reasons: Document is a MetLife insurance brochure / plan summary, not an invoice or medical transport (CMR) or UB04 form.
Contains product overview, plan comparison and rider descriptions typical of marketing/summary materials.

pageClassifications.label: other
reasons: Page contains product brochure / policy features and benefits, not an invoice, CMR, or UB04 form.
Layout is informational text and tables typical of marketing/brochure pages.

notes: Document classified as 'other' because content is an insurance product brochure (MetLife LTC LifeStage Advantage) rather than a facility invoice, CMR form, or UB-04 claim form.

Extracted title and company fields: Document Title (fieldId: title, page: 1) => 'MetLife LTC LifeStage AdvantageSM'; company_name (fieldId: company_name, page: 2) => 'Metropolitan Life Insurance Company'; company_address (fieldId: company_address, page: 2) => 'New York, NY 10166'.

Structured plan comparison data present in tables: top_comparison_table (tableId: top_comparison_table, page: 1) and merged table id 0809af4acea9456eba50a7b61b16b11c-merged (table group id referenced across pages 1-2).

No invoice-specific (policyNumber, invoiceNumber, totalAmount, balanceDue, provider billing info), CMR-specific (service dates, care level selection, signatures) or UB04-specific provider billing block fields were found, so those sections are left empty.

prompt.system:
You are building canonical data for illumifin claims processing. You are given OCR extraction results (fields and tables) for a multi-page document along with page-level document type hints. Classify the overall content into one or more of: 'facility_invoice', 'cmr_form', 'ub04'. Input JSON includes a pages array where each page has fields with IDs, values, and normalized bounding boxes (x, y, width, height all between 0 and 1 relative to the page). When populating sources, always reference the provided field IDs (fieldId) or table IDs (tableId) and include the page number. Table metadata includes column headers/keys and cell-level bounding boxes; include the column name when pointing to table sources. Then produce a JSON object matching this schema exactly: {
  "generatedAt": ISO8601 timestamp,
  "documentTypes": [string],
  "facilityInvoice": { optional, object with keys "general" (dict of canonical field name -> value object) and "lineItems" (list of dict canonicalName->value object) },
  "cmrForm": { optional, similar structure with sections },
  "ub04": { optional, provider fields },
  "notes": [string]
 }.
Each canonical value object must be of form {"value": string or null, "confidence": number 0-1, "sources": [ {"page": int optional, "fieldId": string optional, "tableId": string optional, "column": string optional } ] }. Confidence is your mapping confidence (not OCR confidence). Populate as many facility invoice fields as possible: policyNumber, policyholderName, policyholderAddress, providerName, providerAddress, invoiceNumber, invoiceDate, taxId, totalAmount, balanceDue, credits. For lineItems include description, startDate, endDate, unitType, quantity, amount, balance, totalDue, credits. For CMR include policyNumber, policyholderName, policyholderAddress, providerName, providerAddress, serviceFrom, serviceThrough, careLevelSelection, absenceIndicator (yes/no) plus absenceDetails (departureDate, returnDate, reason, admissionDate, dischargeDate), insuranceIndicator and insuranceSelections (medicare, medicaid, other), signaturePresent (yes/blank) and signatureDate. For UB04 include providerName, providerAddress. Always provide an empty object for a section if it applies but data is missing. If no content applies, set documentTypes to ['other'] and return empty sections. Do not invent data. Leave value as null when evidence is absent. Provide reasoning notes in the notes array when confidence is low.

Preferred (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84), Standard & Substandard (Always quote Standard!)
Premium based on age 30 days prior to application date (underwriting requirements based on age at date of signed application)
With Premium (Conditional Receipt may apply): Date all underwriting requirements are met; Without Premium: 28 days following underwriting approval date

fields.name: Document Title
fields.value: MetLife LTC LifeStage AdvantageSM

fields.name: Subtitle
fields.value: Plans-at-a-Glance

fields.name: Company Name
fields.value: MetLife

fields.name: Simple Plan Name
fields.value: SIMPLE ADVANTAGESM PLAN

fields.name: Custom Plan Name
fields.value: CUSTOM ADVANTAGESM PLAN

fields.name: Simple Plan Type
fields.value: Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available - see below)

fields.name: Custom Plan Type
fields.value: Custom plan options (see column) - Monthly Reimbursement variants

fields.name: Issue Ages (Simple)
fields.value: 18 - 61 (premiums banded 18 - 30)

fields.name: Issue Ages (Custom)
fields.value: 18 - 84 (premiums banded 18 - 30)

fields.name: TBA Note
fields.value: *$1MM not available with Cash Benefit Rider

fields.name: Optional Riders Heading
fields.value: OPTIONAL RIDERS AVAILABLE WITH BOTH SIMPLE ADVANTAGE AND CUSTOM ADVANTAGE

fields.name: Shared Care Rider
fields.value: Insured and spouse/partner** can access benefits under each other's policy once the TBA under their own policy is exhausted. When insured dies, remaining TBA under his/her policy is transferred to the spouse's/partner's policy at no extra cost. Rider available at any time, subject to underwriting; Both spouse/partners must have identical policies.

fields.name: Nonforfeiture Rider
fields.value: Provides some benefits if policy lapses for nonpayment of premiums or if cancelled by insured. Rider must be in effect for 3 years and be in effect when the policy ends. Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA. Available at initial application only.

fields.name: Cash Benefit Rider
fields.value: Full MBA paid as cash payment (regardless of actual charges incurred) instead of reimbursement for covered services. Available at initial application only; $1MM TBA not available. Benefits paid over annual IRC limit may be taxable.

fields.name: Guaranteed Purchase Option (GPO) Heading
fields.value: GUARANTEED PURCHASE OPTION (GPO) (INCLUDED WITH SIMPLE ADVANTAGE ONLY)

fields.name: GPO Summary
fields.value: Insured able to purchase additional coverage every 3 years, up to age 65, with no additional underwriting; premium for increase in coverage is at attained age rates. Lifetime maximum increase available is 2x initial TBA and 2x initial MBA. Minimum of 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time GPO is exercised. Increases will not occur if insured is eligible for benefits. If insured rejects two increase offers in a row rider will end.

fields.name: Benefit Increase Options Heading
fields.value: BENEFIT INCREASE OPTIONS (AVAILABLE WITH CUSTOM ADVANTAGE ONLY)

fields.name: Future Purchase Option (FPO) Summary
fields.value: Increases the MBA and remaining portion of the TBA automatically by 5% of the MBA/remaining TBA in effect at the end of the previous policy year. Increases occur unless insured rejects, in writing, prior to the Policy Anniversary of the year in which the increase is to take effect. Corresponding increase in premium for increase in coverage at attained age rates. If insured rejects two times in a row, insured will no longer receive automatic increases; may request to have offers reinstated with no additional underwriting. Rider available at any time, subject to underwriting.

fields.name: Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Riders
fields.value: Increases the MBA and remaining portion of the TBA in effect at the end of the previous policy year, either 3% or 5%, with no corresponding increase in premium. Coverage increases continue while insured is eligible for benefits. Rider available at any time, with additional underwriting. 3% Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Rider and 5% Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Rider.

rows.value: Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available - see below)

fields.name: document_title
fields.value: Policy Features and Benefits May Vary By State

fields.name: main_header
fields.value: FEATURES & BENEFITS AVAILABLE WITH BOTH SIMPLE ADVANTAGETM AND CUSTOM ADVANTAGETM

fields.name: distribution_note
fields.value: FOR PRODUCER OR BROKER/DEALER USE ONLY. NOT FOR PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION.

fields.name: company_name
fields.value: Metropolitan Life Insurance Company

fields.value: Not FDIC - Insured - Not Insured by Any Federal Government Agency - Not Issued, Guaranteed or Underwritten by Bank or FDIC - Not a Condition to the Provision or Term of Any Banking Service or Activity - Policy is an Obligation of the Issuing Insurance Company

tables.caption: Features & Benefits (both Simple Advantage and Custom Advantage)

rows.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Home care services including Nursing Care, Therapy services, Care Advisory Services, Homemaker Services; Services by Home Care Aide, Social Worker or Independent Caregiver; Hospice Care; Adult Day Care
Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Assisted Living Facility, Nursing Home, Hospice Facility
100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative

A MetLife Care Coordinator may authorize benefits for OLTC services not specifically defined as covered services under the policy, as long as the service meets needs of the insured and is cost-effective.
Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred to reserve insured's bed in a facility for any reason
If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate

Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA limits and doubling for International Benefit after 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider added, International Benefit modified; pays benefits outside US at 100% of MBA; EP will be 100 Calendar Days

Limited coverage if policy ends due to non-payment; provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: total amount of premium paid or 1x MBA; total benefits paid will not exceed the TBA in effect immediately prior to nonforfeiture date
1 visit per lifetime; EP does not need to be satisfied; If Care Management organization is selected by MetLife – no cost; if selected by insured – reimbursed up to $275 per lifetime
Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits
Coordination of Benefits (COB) and non-duplication of coverage with MetLife LTCI coverage and Medicare; non-duplication not applicable with Cash Benefit Rider
Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT); 10 Year Premium Payment Rider available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO; May impact tax deductibility
MetLife Care Coordinators available to answer questions about LTC coverage, services and discounts; insured can call for advice about caring for a loved one who needs LTC services
